website_summaries.verdict: The Asus ZenPad 3S 10 is a fantastic portable video watcher with enough storage to get you through long flights at a reasonable price.
pros: The Asus ZenPad 3S 10 has a sharp, clear HD screen and its design is both comfy and cool
The fingerprint scanner adds extra security
Comes with a good amount of storage for its price
cons: The speakers are easy to block when holding in landscape orientation
Games take their time to load

customer_reviews.title: If you ever think you might need warranty service, DO NOT BUY THIS TABLET
customer_reviews.text: ASIS refuses warranty service without customer provided Serial Number After dozens of emails back and fourth ASUS has made it clear that they will not honor a warranty unless the customer provides a serial number. There is no serial number attached to the actual tablet. ASUS states the serial number is only on the original box, or the original warranty card. After several months of ownership, I do not have access to those items. ASUS will allow the purchaser to send in the unit for examination charging a $60.000 nonrefundable fee. If you ever think you might need warranty service, DO NOT BUY THIS TABLET.
customer_reviews.author: G. P. Neer

customer_reviews.title: ASUS dropped a PERFECT tablet.
customer_reviews.text: I didn't want to post a review until I had some significant time with it. I LOVE it. I can't compare it to any other tablet as this is the only one I use ... but it's fast, responsive, bright, colorful and does EVERYTHING I need it to do. I don't share the same 'battery' opinions as most people on here. Yes, the battery life isn't 2,458 hours long ... but I never use it for more than 2 hours at a time anyhow. It lasts an entire flight from coast to coast (USA), with power to spare, so that's a win in my book. For the price, this was a steal.
customer_reviews.author: Bigg Russ

customer_reviews.title: Excellent tablet, to save 100 bucks off the price ...
customer_reviews.text: Excellent tablet, to save 100 bucks off the price of buying the galaxy tab 2 this is an easy decision. The features available on this tablet are great for the price point. The screen is just beautiful. Really sharp and great for watching videos or reading books or magazines. Now that ASUS has officially sent out the new Android Nougut as an over the air update the user experience and interface are so much cleaner. Really happy with the purchase. Obviously the camera isn't great on this tablet, but if you're doing for this tablet, chances are you probably have a decent phone that takes better pictures right in your pocket. I definitely don't regret this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Lenny Breaks

customer_reviews.title: The second ASUS product I've purchased and both have died after a year. Won't happen again.
customer_reviews.text: Most amazing tablet I've ever seen. It's got everything. Apple wishes they could make a tablet this nice. Microsoft drools then hangs their heads in shame. It's beautiful, fast, feature-packed and software updates keep coming. It's now June 2018, a year after purchase and just as nice as day 1. It still out performs any other tablet I've ever seen. ***** UPDATE: 17 MONTHS AFTER PURCHASE IT IS DEAD. IT WILL NOT ACCEPT A CHARGE OR POWER ON. ASUS WILL NOT REPAIR OR REPLACE UNDER WARRANTY. I GUESS I'LL ATTEMPT TO REPAIR IT MYSELF. *****
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: I have been in love with this tablet so far
customer_reviews.text: I have been in love with this tablet so far. It is fast and snappy. Battery life is great. Comfortable to hold even with as big as it is. Let's me get work done and is easy to use. Screen is pretty and lots of nice features. Has been a great computer replacement in my small living space and traveling for work so I can put my work laptop in actual luggage rather than carry-on.
customer_reviews.author: Rei H

customer_reviews.title: Not Qualcomm Quick Charge 3 Compatible
customer_reviews.text: Disappointed that the Asus Zenpad 3s 10 does NOT support Qualcomm Quick Charge 3. Found out after buying Qualcomm Quick Charge devices. MediaTek has a competing quick charge standard called Pump Express 3.0 but it is difficult to find chargers. The supplied charger is not quick charge. Reports that its battery life is short are true. I was hoping that a Quick Charge external battery would alleviate the problem but it turned out to be a waste of money. Apparently Pump Express is prevalent in Asia but unavailable in the US.
customer_reviews.author: JGLLO

customer_reviews.title: Keeps dying
customer_reviews.text: About to send it in for repair...2nd time in two months. It just keeps dying and won't turn on. Extremely disappointed with this product!! I use this for ebooks and a little web surfing. I've only used it 3 times since it was repaired under warranty and it's now doing the exact same thing. I can anticipate throwing this away very soon. ASUS doesn't care....won't even extend warranty due to repairs.
customer_reviews.author: ZKat2

customer_reviews.title: Wow.  Nice Tablet
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased with this tablet. This thing is lighting fast, I mean lighting fast. Apps open without any hesitation, Wi-Fi is extremely fast thanks to the AC speed (as long as your router supports this speed), screen resolution is gorgeous, games play without any stuttering, the light sensor is immediate, none of this slowly fading in/out going on other tablets, it's lightweight and the ASUS UI is simply brilliant. It is an absolute pleasure to use. Did I mention this thing is fast. Great Tablet.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: BEING DUPED BY ASUS
customer_reviews.text: BUYER BEWARE !! I purchased an Asus Zen Pad and I have absolutely loved it - until now. In the past two days the battery will no longer charge. I got out the papers to re-order a battery and discovered the battery cannot be replaced. I have to send the tablet back to Asus, pay a $60 advance fee to determine the problem,Asus will then contact me by email and advise of the repair charges, which have to be paid in advance. I WILL DEFINITELY NEVER PURCHASE ANOTHER ASUS PRODUCT !!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: it's a tablet that doesn't get along with wifi
customer_reviews.text: When it's good, its very good - great color; fast speed; very light. But when it's bad, it's horrid. The bad part, as other reviewers have pointed out, is the inconsistency of the wi-fi connection. Nearly every day, at some point, the tablet loses its connection. It takes a good 5 minutes, and usually requires a restart, to get the connection back. And it's clearly the tablet. All the lights on the router are green, and my other household tablets, phones, laptops all work fine. I know it's inexpensive, but I'd never buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: constant reader

customer_reviews.title: Best tablet 2017
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic in every possible way. The ZenUI is great, the dedicated home and menu buttons, the screen resolution, small bezel, fantastic battery life and quick charging, and absolutely blazing fast. Warning. If you do try this one, you won't be able to use a tablet with less than 4GB of ram anymore. This thing is like a 10" phone and I love everything about it. Absolutely no complaints.
customer_reviews.author: davoz28caboose

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Tablet for a (previously) anti tablet gal
customer_reviews.text: I have never really been a tablet fan, but I am now converted. I have an Asus Zenbook, but didn't always want to pull it out and definitely didn't want to drag it with me when travelling, so decided to give the ZenPad a try. I find myself reaching for it more often than I thought I would. This tablet is gorgeous, thin and light, responsive with great resolution for watching movies. In my opinion it has 2 features that could use improvement...poor battery life and iffy fingerprint function. For me these are inconvenient, but not deal breakers considering all the other good features and price.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah

customer_reviews.title: Great picture, good speed, but stuck at 7.0
customer_reviews.text: Great picture quality, good speed for it's age, I mainly use this table to browse online, Reddit, watch Netflix and play non-demanding casual games. For those functions, this tablet works perfectly. My main gripe is it's lack of software updates or ability to root the device. If you're looking for one of the faster android tables available at an affordable price, I'd still recommend the ZenPad S3 10, however if you're hoping to run anything newer than Android 7.0, this isn't ever going to get that update.
customer_reviews.author: Mike C

customer_reviews.title: Bad Display
customer_reviews.text: I was really happy at first, but within hours I discovered a major malfunction. In the display settings I put brightness level at its maximum. However, screen kept dimming and then coming back at a frequency of 10-15 seconds. It drove me crazy. I rebooted the device but the problem remained. I had to return it. I would order a replacement but I am afraid to run into the same problem.
customer_reviews.author: Alchemist585

customer_reviews.title: I absolutely love this thing.
customer_reviews.text: This has got to be the best "bang for the buck" tablet out there. It's performance is awesome. Display is gorgeous. It really would be 5 stars if not for some build quality issues. The brand new tablet came with part of the screen not fully in the shell (picture attached). While I was able to snap it in, the screen still moves a bit if touched in that spot. I saw some people complaining about camera quality, but that really isn't why I bought this so I don't care. In my opinion, tablets are great for viewing pictures. If you want to take awesome shots go but a nice dslr, you won't regret it.
customer_reviews.author: An Honest Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: Does not stream HD NETFLIX OR PRIME VIDEO.
customer_reviews.text: If you are buying this tablet to watch HD Netflix and Amazon Prime Video, DON'T. The amount of deception from ASUS,Netflix, and especially Amazon is astounding. The Asus Zenpad 3S 10 has 4gb of ram and a hexacore processor, I can watch 1440P videos on YouTube without a single stutter but apparently this tablet isn't a supported HD device for either Netflix or Amazon. It supports Level 1 Widevine DRM yet absolutely no HD streaming. Don't get me wrong, it's a great tablet but it's being marketed as a "cinematic experience tablet" without supporting basic HD streaming.
customer_reviews.author: Fabio Da Rocha

customer_reviews.title: Dead after a few days
customer_reviews.text: Lasted 3 days before it stopped working. Tried to perform the hard reset as recommended by Asus under the other negative reviews but all I could get, repeatedly, was a splash screen that appeared for about 15 seconds before going black. The build quality was also suspect. When I pressed on the screen I could feel movement on the right side edges and hear creaking sounds. Returning, spending extra $100 for Galaxy Tab S2 9.7.
customer_reviews.author: TJP

customer_reviews.title: Beauty assured, Specs are truth... Use and feel the ASUS power!
customer_reviews.text: Obviously, i've read all the specs... and it's true: divine, in shape and weight: but, when i use, i review these particular items: 1. Fast... true! 2. Beauty... garanteed! 3. Sounds... RED LIGHT! Has only one speaker down the fingerprint lector... and it's so loud, that the first point of volume is very strong, if you know what i mean... 4. Quality picture... astonishing! The color and shapes are REALLY and TRULLY vivid... 5. Fingerprint... works impressively! 6. SD Compartiment... STOP! it's so tiny, that you need a needle-type of instrument that came with the manuals... Overall, i like it... a lot, really... bought it!
customer_reviews.author: Max Ace

customer_reviews.title: Good speed, poor construction, inexplicable screen breakage, TOO EXPENSIVE TO FIX
customer_reviews.text: I was enjoying the table but for the poor construction. The screen had sharp, unprotected glass bezel all around it. It had a poorly installed chrome ring around its outside, but it was sharp to the touch and did not protect the glass. Eventually the glass screen broke while sitting on a table by itself, and I sent it in for replacement. No local shops will handle it as it requires a complete breakdown to get to the screen. The cost to repair the glass? $260! DO NOT BUY THIS UNLESS YOU HAVE GLASS DAMAGE INSURANCE
customer_reviews.author: J Olivier

customer_reviews.title: Fast and crisp tablet.
customer_reviews.text: I had doubt with this tablet before but after receiving and using it , I change my mind. Display is crisp comparable to Ipad, it made the ebooks look really appealing. Processor is fast I believe from its solid state drive (eMMC) impresses me as well. I own it for about a month, now it is automatically upgraded to Android 7. Thanks to Asus. The only downside is the battery drain. Normal use one day per full charge vs. couple of days for Ipad. I do recommend this Android tablet.
customer_reviews.author: Ben A.

customer_reviews.title: Decent but not able to find accessories
customer_reviews.text: This table was actually really decent. I only gave it a three star review because the keyboard was worthless. No matter how many times you add a word to the dictionary it still autocorrects you to something else. When using this for work that was something that was just too much to overlook. The other thing is that you can only find generic tablet accessories for this and not stuff that would fit really well so overall it wasnt convenient either. If those two issues were not present, I would have kept it because it really was a decent tablet. It just doesnt suit my needs and I need to find something better that does.
customer_reviews.author: Renea Tranick

customer_reviews.title: Very fast, stable, and consistant.
customer_reviews.text: Ive been using this thing for everything programing, web browsing, 3d gaming, YouTube, other video sites, Facebook, video chat, SSH, etc., and NOTHING slows it down. Battery last long enough and drains consistently. This thing is very stable. I am very satisfied and recommend this to everyone who talks about getting a new tablet or laptop.
customer_reviews.author: Derddy Dert

customer_reviews.title: Great tablet
customer_reviews.text: I love it so far!! Love the clear picture and how easy it is to get around inside, I'm not real tech savvy, so the easier the better. It starts up really fast, like right now. My other one took forever. It charges up within 11/2 to 2 hours on an empty battery. The speakers sound good. I like the 9.7" screen size. I like that it has 4GB RAM. I did a lot of research and heard good things about this tablet. I only had it a couple of months so far and I like what I see.
customer_reviews.author: alane

customer_reviews.title: This is definitely the best tablet in its price range
customer_reviews.text: This is definitely the best tablet in its price range. high quality and detail, sleek design, quick response, can run high end apps and games with ease. The only 3 reasons i didnt give 5 stars is the camera is terrible, the battery doesnt last long and takes 3hrs to fully charge, and it doesnt support hdmi out through the usb c port. I dont understand why it doesnt support usb c to hdmi out. I havent fully tested it but i havent been able to get anything to connect through usb c port, i.e. keyboard, mouse, game pad. It seems it can only be used for charging and transfering pictures and video.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A relatively good product... Asus provides lousy support.
customer_reviews.text: This is a product in search of an identity. It's extremely difficult to find any support for this from Asus as it gets lumped into their ZenPhone products. After 2 years, this tablet is exhibiting battery charger and power retaining problems. It is draining on an increasingly faster cadence if plugged in while in use. It is now only possible to charge it by turning the unit off and plugging it in... taking > 12 hours to get it fully charged. I'm sure it would take a battery replacement to fix this, but I can find no instructions on how this might be possible, nor can I get any support from Asus on finding any help on doing this.
customer_reviews.author: Karlk

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the headache!!
customer_reviews.text: First order received was faulty, would not power on even after charging overnight- replacement tablet powered on but screen would lock up once or twice a day- after 1 wk., would not power on- called support and they had no answers, just said to ship it back! Did't want to try for strike 3! The camera is absolutely horrible and not even worth using. Over all, this tablet was a GREAT disappointment. Customer service is almost non-existant. Don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: gator girl

customer_reviews.title: Amazing tablet
customer_reviews.text: Tablets works great pretty simple to setup, fast and classy. The camera sucks big time dont buy for picture taking. Def buy a case and screen protector highly recommened. You hold it with one hand and it feels like your going to drop it so buy xase, screen protector. Battery life could be better but its cool. It has app manager. Screen quality looks amazing real 1440p and great color speakers are ok for casual listening not to fill a room with music. But overall i give it a 8.5/10 mostly for battery life and camera quality. I recommend over an ipad or samsung only WIFI by the way.
customer_reviews.author: hernando

customer_reviews.title: Nice screen but quality issues caused me to return for refund after 2 devices
customer_reviews.text: It's a very pretty device and at a great price point but quality control issues abound. First device I received had a major issue with the wifi. It was so weak that it only worked when right next to the router and even then it was really slow. I returned that one and the replacement came in and had a massive dent in the left side. See the picture. Returned for refund and bought the Huawei mediapad m3 which is way faster and better for gaming anyway.
customer_reviews.author: C0untDeM0net

customer_reviews.title: Happy with it.
customer_reviews.text: Not a detailed review however, I am very happy with this tablet. For what I use a tablet for its perfect. Battery life seems pretty good its fast and appears to have plenty of storage. I did have a problem with it recovering from stand by mode once but it hasn't happened again since so we will call that a one off at this point. I surf a little, play some youtube and a couple of games. It handles multiple apps/games pretty well. I am not happy with the case options out there for it. I would love an Otterbox but they don't make anything for Asus. Your restricted mostly to some type of wallet case.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry M.

customer_reviews.title: An Everyday Tablet That Sacrifices Some Quality
customer_reviews.text: After a few weeks of utilizing the tablet for video playback and everyday browsing, the OS runs just fine and there is a little lag. I give it four stars due to the quality of build. I placed this in a hard snap on case. I tried to remove it from the case and the tablet stayed in the case, but the screen popped out in one corner. I was able to snap it back easy with no disruption to the picture quality. Maybe a little overpriced for the quality, but overall a good buy.
customer_reviews.author: LOCKX112

customer_reviews.title: Had this tablet for 4 days only got to use ...
customer_reviews.text: Had this tablet for 4 days only got to use it maybe 2 hours and keyboard was freezing up while typing the whole time. I let it charge over night and it will not longer turn on. Tried many different support forums and got it to show fastboot mode after holding volume up and power button for 5 or so seconds but it is now stuck o. This fastboot screen and will never turn on.
customer_reviews.author: Scott C.

customer_reviews.title: This product should be taken off the market
customer_reviews.text: I wasted my money and so will you, should have trusted the bad reviews on this better. The battery is a total fail, works okay when you keep wifi off. However, this tablet will NO longer work after about 5 months of gentle use. I got Amazon to assist with getting it running again and it died again. Haven't bothered to bring it back to life. So disappointed. ASUS made a powerful processor, but battery and whatever other problems make this tablet a poor product. How do I get a refund or credit toward something that works? This is my 4th tablet, I am back using my 3rd tablet, which is working fabulously after a reset, a Samsung Galaxy.
customer_reviews.author: Joy Lokey

customer_reviews.title: Loses wifi connection
customer_reviews.text: Had high hopes because of premium features like 64G storage, great sound, beautiful display, etc. However, from the beginning it would lose wifi connection, in spite of very strong signal Tried everything to correct, including total reset, to no avail. Concluded bad antenna in the unit. Sent it back to Amazon for refund and bought Samsung tab A 10.5, which I love and recommend. Judging from the number of 1-star reviews, buying this tablet is quite risky. Don't buy the Asus 3s 10.
customer_reviews.author: Richard C. Mortensen

customer_reviews.title: I want one for me now!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this table for my wife for Christmas. I want one for me now! Beautiful piece of hardware, excellent performance, the screen is amazing and it sounds great too! ASUS includes some nice tools with the tablet along with the usual Android bloatware. With 6 processors, 4 Gb of RAM, 64G or storage plus a micro SD slot, this tablet is built to last!
customer_reviews.author: bluelightsmove

customer_reviews.title: It's a brick
customer_reviews.text: This was my first Asus purchase and my last. The battery drains from 100 to 0 in less than 10 hours of standby. It's definitely not a Wi-Fi issue because it constantly drops its connection. You'll need the fast charge feature as you'll most likely need to charge it several times during the day with any kind of active use. I've owned at least 10 various brands of Android tablets and this one is the worst by far.
customer_reviews.author: WSN

customer_reviews.title: Good tablet, but you're stuck on Android 7
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Great display Quite powerful for the price Pretty good built-in ASUS apps Fast Cons: You're stuck on Android 7 as ASUS refuses to update this tablet even though it's quite capable of running newer versions of Android. It's unacceptable that you buy a new tablet and can't get a single OS upgrade and I've already ran into apps that won't run on it recently and I'm guessing that's because of the Android version. This will be my last ASUS product as they don't support their products. If they'd update it, I'd change this to a 5 star rating.
customer_reviews.author: Ben Purdue

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I am disappointed. I thought I'd finally found an excellent replacement for the Samsung Galaxy Tab-A that I've had for three years. That tablet was running low on performance in comparison to others, and I was tired of the bogus Samsung way of putting the Android 'buttons' in the wrong places. I hate to admit it, but I'm thinking of going back to that tablet. Why? The battery life of this tablet is pretty terrible, compared to my three-year-old tablet. Everything else about the Asus is great, but battery life is really important to me.
customer_reviews.author: Debborah Richmond

customer_reviews.title: Good buy
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a birthday gift for a roommate to replace another 10 inch tablet that wasn't getting Android updates. The roommate loves it and is very happy with getting updates reasonably quickly after they are released. The roommate plays games on it constantly and never complains. The Asus was significantly cheaper than a similar Samsung and Pixel so it was well worth the buy. I am surprised that 6 months after release these are still priced about the same as at release time.
customer_reviews.author: Hickabilly

customer_reviews.title: It works great for me and I love the multiple window function
customer_reviews.text: I use this mostly for browsing the internet, drawing, and updating social media. It works great for me and I love the multiple window function. The only issue I've had since I bought it is that after extended use, usually a few weeks, the internet will stop connecting unless I restart the tablet. I know this is a problem with the tablet because none of my other devices ever have the same issue. It's an easy fix, annoying but only takes a few seconds. Definitely not a deal breaker.
customer_reviews.author: Dragon Queen

customer_reviews.title: Excellent with one glitch
customer_reviews.text: There are many detailed reviews and it is an excellent tablet with great picture quality, so I just want to mention one con that I didn't see which drives me crazy. The screen goes black randomly, usually when it's plugged into the charger and I'm playing a game. Sometimes it will turn back on if I rotate horizontal and vertical but usually I'm fighting with it for a couple of minutes and re-logging in multiple before it starts working again. I've had it for several months now and it still does it regularly, but other that that one thing I love this tablet.
customer_reviews.author: dogsinfl

customer_reviews.title: Nothing but a big ole black paperweight.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this tablet 1 September 2017. 24 days later, it's nothing but a paperweight. It no longer accepts a charge by the charger provided. I tried to charge it up by the computer USB port, nothing. Nothing but a big ole black paperweight. Update: I contacted Amazon, they agreed to refund my money. They were very nice about the whole situation. This time I ordered the Samsung Galaxy Tab S3 9.7 to replace that big paperweight.
customer_reviews.author: Blue Room

customer_reviews.title: You will be better off buying a Huawei =/
customer_reviews.text: Looked like a good option on paper, but actually having it, I regret buying it. Though it works ok, the bloatware it comes with is unbearable and it constantly tries to push fake updates which crash the system (search for Asus FOTAService and you'll know...). Customer support is nonexistent and even community support is scarce and requires hours of digging online to find an answer for some other Asus product which you might apply to this one and hope it works. Huawei is a much higher quality brand, should have gone for that one, now I know...
customer_reviews.author: Gustavo Gutiérrez

customer_reviews.title: Great while it lasted, but died after 2 years
customer_reviews.text: I bought this pad in July of 2017. It worked great and loved it for that time and then this week, all of the sudden, it died. The screen started to glitch out and it would hang. I would restart it, only to have it hang a minute later. Finally it just stopped booting or powering up at all. Even with holding buttons down for over a minute to try and do some sort of recovery. It has turned into a brick 2 years almost to to the day after I bought it.
customer_reviews.author: Mako

customer_reviews.title: FAST, Nice Screen, Quality Build
customer_reviews.text: Very Fast. Nice screen. Very good build quality. I've previously had a Samsung S2 and an Ipad Air 2. I like the Zenpad better than either one. Cameras are not great but I use the front camera for EBay and the rear for Skype so they meet my needs.si Battery life has been better than I was lead to believe and is more than adequate with the availability of quick charging. Intermittent 5ghz WiFi issue seems to be related to router chipset incompatibility since I had problems with one router but none with the other. I'll have to investigate what chipsets are being used.
customer_reviews.author: John Shaw Hodson

customer_reviews.title: ... 1 star only because of the build quality very nice. i received the tablet today went to turn ...
customer_reviews.text: Only giving this 1 star only because of the build quality very nice.i received the tablet today went to turn it on and it will not turn on screen is flashing very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Wattenbarger

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY THIS PRODUCT
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product in October of 2018. I can no longer turn it on in March of 2019. I contacted ASUS to see if the product was still under warranty. They said it was. I paid $15 to send it in to have it repaired. The tablet had no damage other. I just received notification from the repair center that I have to pay for the repairs because it is no longer under warranty or is user damage. DO NOT BUY this PRODUCT.
customer_reviews.author: Katrine Maguire

customer_reviews.title: Good while it lasted
customer_reviews.text: I knew it was weak when I bought it. Using apps like Realtor.com and some games the hold lots of information and picture would crash this tablet several times a night. The picture was nice, the battery lasted as much as you might expect and it charged quickly. Unfortunately the screen stress cracked and stopped functioning. I don't know if it was the Arizona heat or the dog but it cracked diagonally starting from the button up to about the volume control.
customer_reviews.author: distorteddogma

customer_reviews.title: Power, Speed, Brilliance and Quality Build!
customer_reviews.text: Upgrading from Lenovo Tab 2 A10-70F (2015). Initial impression: Looks and feels Great! Initial serup: Hmm this setup is moving along smoothly. Transfer of Google apps: Fastest I have ever experienced! (64 apps downloaded and installed in 8 mins!) System OS upgrade: Zoom Zoom! Testing apps: Gaming... Outstanding! 1080 video streaming... Oh my... Granted this is only day 1. I will explore this beast with more furver as soon as my Bt keyboard case arrives. I need to protect this gem ASAP! I would like to have found the Z pen, might show up somewhere some how some way. Device was well received into my family of network devices.
customer_reviews.author: PRKilduff

customer_reviews.title: Lovely screen but...
customer_reviews.text: I like the speed in how it operates. I love its screen. I love the sound, I wish it could have better controls like some other devices do. I do not like that, at times, it goes off and comes back with some other 'portal screens' which cannot be unlocked forcing me to reboot the system. Sometimes that works, sometimes not, forcing me to shut down power, wait a few seconds and power up again. It is Android version M. Funny thing is an inexpensive RCA tablet running same system, operated for hours to no end. I stopped liking it because of its weight and so, so screen until it cracked.
customer_reviews.author: Guayito

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product, excellent value!
customer_reviews.text: I am going on my 6th tablet, all Android so can't compare to Apple. But, this ZenPad is simply super! Great performance, fast, easy to use, lots of options, high-quality, great screen size. I was hesitant to buy a 10 inch tablet ... seemed so large compared to my others. But now I'm hooked. I also bought a Logitech keyboard and the combo make for a really neat, compact portable laptop, too. Very satisfied!
customer_reviews.author: QYC

customer_reviews.title: Its a nice thin tablet with 2K video
customer_reviews.text: Its a nice thin tablet with 2K video! Going to use it as a media machine mainly and maybe a game streamer so I can play my steam games on it. All in all its a solid product and the sellers are very helpful. Oh and did I mention its Asus and a Zen Tablet? What more do u need :)
customer_reviews.author: Terry Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Light, sleek, good sound, modern Android OS
customer_reviews.text: First Android tablet. It's very sleek and light. Been iPad user forever, but I can get on board with this...especially since it's less than half the price of a comparable Apple. I think this uses one of the newer Android operating systems, and as such, my favorite app (Zinio magazine app) does not function well...but that's not the fault of Asus. Would definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Chris O.

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work for me
customer_reviews.text: It's very smooth and fast, good design, I really like it at first. Then the problems started. Every time I tried to use Napster the whole thing locked up and wouldn't turn back on for 10 minutes. I could have gotten over that, because I really only bought this thing to use for flying my drones. It worked great for that, for about 2 weeks. Then it would no longer connect to my drones. I tried reinstalling apps, even did a factory reset, but it didn't help. Had to return it.
customer_reviews.author: Jack L.

customer_reviews.title: Wouldn't buy in 2019
customer_reviews.text: I bought this in 2017. For some reason ASUS decided it would squeeze 3+ years of blood out of this stone, and it's still on their website as if it's a hot new product. It still runs Android 7.0 and has physical buttons (the light up back and multitask buttons are poor design). My screen has light blooms in part of the screen indicative of cheap LCD's. It still performs pretty well though, which is important, as long as you stick to mainstream games and apps.
customer_reviews.author: Troy in Austin

customer_reviews.title: Very good tablet, but poorly placed speakers are very disappointing
customer_reviews.text: I really like the performance of this tablet. I purchased it because of the 4 GB of Ram, which is great at this price point. I'm totally satisfied with it so far, except one thing. The speakers should be on the opposite sides when holding the tablet in landscape orientation, not portrait. When your watching a movie, (while holding it in landscape orientation) all of the sound is coming out of one side & you are probably blocking 1 of the 2 poorly placed speakers with your hand!
customer_reviews.author: Moose & Squirrel

customer_reviews.title: Got this tablet on the 17th January 2017 and today ...
customer_reviews.text: Got this tablet on the 17th January 2017 and today 16th March 2017 it just died and won't turn on
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Died fast
customer_reviews.text: It did not last long. The Wi-Fi stopped working, then the screen showed garbage, then i could not turned off, reset, or slow the spiral death which happened soon after. I searched for a way to preserve it cryogenically but the technology is not there. So I dug six feet hole in the yard, buried it and hoped that ASUS goes under soon.
customer_reviews.author: MasterStylist

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable and Unstable
customer_reviews.text: I returned 2 of these because they randomly get stuck or reboot. Would be a great product if it were reliable
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Asus disappoints me once again.
customer_reviews.text: Should have stuck to my gut and left the Asus tablets alone. I had to return the original one right away and have owned this zen pad for about 18 months and in the time it's blacked out yhree times with no warning. The 2 previous times it just started working again after about a day. This time nothing. Although I've never dropped the unit it had a dent next to the camera that I never noticed since I put it in a case right away. The glass seem to not be completely sealed and would appear to lift. I shouldn't have to get a new tablet every other year.
customer_reviews.author: Working Mom

customer_reviews.title: faster processor with better camera solution with a lower price point would be ...
customer_reviews.text: Miserable. I bought 8 of these for work and I have 4 in the first 5 months that have failed, one already been through the repair RMA process and the other 3 are heading for the recycling. Too unreliable to use in a work environment. Several problems with them such as will not charge, freezing and will not restart and and dropping WIFI signal. We used to use iPads but decided that a new modern, faster processor with better camera solution with a lower price point would be great but I was badly mistaken. I will never buy an ASUS product again as if they really care, they would stand behind their products.
customer_reviews.author: Russell Scoates

customer_reviews.title: I still love this tablet
customer_reviews.text: After a little more than a year of usage, I still love this tablet. I use it nearly every day while traveling with work; primarily for websurfing, stored video play/videostreaming but occasionally to tinker with a spreadsheet. This thing works great and I'm glad I purchased, one of the best tech purchases I've made in a few years and has allowed me to not carry a laptop for light computing needs.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: 18 months and
customer_reviews.text: Loved it for a year, then battery took a dive. After a year I was getting about 80% of original battery life, sometimes it shut down on it's own and is difficult to restart. I really liked this machine. It has a lot going for it, but my kids ipad air is over 4 years old and problem free. It doesn't look like I have any available warranty claim.
customer_reviews.author: Tire Eater

customer_reviews.title: A lot of useless stuff embedded in the OS.
customer_reviews.text: I own this tablet for about a year. The tablet finally bricked after another update and won't turn off. Tried a few advices posted on the internet to no avail. I give tablet one star because it is literally impossible to turn updates off (this is what I usually do for vendor updates that are usually next to useless, not google store updates). All in all, the tablet has decent hardware and good look, but unfortunately ASUS embedded lot of crap to the OS with no way to opt out of it and spoiled this tablet. Oh, and their online support is pathetic. I'll never buy anything from ASUS again.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Zippy & great color
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Asus pad, so I'm biased a bit. It came right up & easy to set up, tho' I'll grant that having a Google account already made it easy to download from the so-called "cloud." Nice fast WiFi -- can stream hi-res movies w/ no hiccups. So far as I know it's not rootable. I'd recommend replacing the Asus keyboard w/ "Hacker's Keyboard" (from Play Store) to reduce the insanely wrong autocorrects.
customer_reviews.author: Carl Witthoft

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: Outstanding product. I bought a second one. Crisp screen screamin 4 gig ram handy 64 SSD reduces need for chip but does have chip slot so can easily bring many movies or work files on your trip I'll add from my many tablets experience that this 10 inch is perfect size for all activities. My 8 inch is equally good a ebook reader but not games my 12 inch is good for some thing but not better for most things, 10 is best multipurpose size.
customer_reviews.author: RickioLoto14

customer_reviews.title: Super buy
customer_reviews.text: Well made and works great. Fast processing and an awesome display. There seems to be Software glitch maybe connected to the proximity sensor. I turn it on sometimes and it will immediately shut off. Move it around a little and its fine. I returned one because the SD card holder would not open no later what. The reason for buying this instead of IPad was the ability to add memory.
customer_reviews.author: Reader Greg

customer_reviews.title: Best Tablet Ever
customer_reviews.text: This is by far the best tablet ever. Fast, no problems playing the games I love(evony-the king's return), and others. Absolutely no problems with charging or anything else. One thing to be careful of however when charging is to make sure to pay attention to how you plug the charging cable into the charging port. Be certain it is aligned properly. As long as you do that you will have no problems at all. I love this tablet!!! And you just can't beat the price for a tablet of this quality.
customer_reviews.author: Uncle Louie

customer_reviews.title: Quality Camera
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE: I have now gone through 2 of these devices. They both lost power and would not charge or turn back on. I'm returning the 2nd unit today. Would NOT recommend. I have only had this for less than 24 hours, but I love it already. It is no as heavy as I thought it would feel. I love the ease of setup and that I don't have to strain to read my screens with just their unadjusted settings. The camera on it is better than the one on my phone too.
customer_reviews.author: RLCBNHH

customer_reviews.title: Tremendous even after a year and a half
customer_reviews.text: This review is a very late one - I've owned this tablet for 1.5 years (since release). This is one of the best performing Android devices I've owned, and it sees routine use for video, web surfing, email and reddit. I've been expecting it to slow down or the battery life to get worse, but it just keeps on running like a top. I haven't even reset it once in the time I've used it. It is simply a well made, well designed device that holds up great for a long time!
customer_reviews.author: Matthew S

customer_reviews.title: Good product and service from Asus
customer_reviews.text: Received my replacement Asus Zen Pad 3S yesterday. The replacement worked as it should. The problem encountered with the first tablet showed the SD card could not be recognized. When I called yesterday, the service representative knew what he was doing. He worked with me over the phone to prove that the SD card must be of high quality, which he confirmed is what I had. Then he guided me to transfer music and video to it. Which worked. He was patient and dedicated and made me respect the service from Asus. So far I found inserting the SD card needed a little fiddling.
customer_reviews.author: Macfat

customer_reviews.title: A Solid Product.
customer_reviews.text: Let me first say I am not a power user, do not demand super fast performance or graphics and the camera function although adequate, not a big need for me since I am a pro photographer and of course use pro gear. I expected solid reliability, good battery life, and nice looking graphics and sound. It delivered. Going on about 1 year now my Asus has been turned on 24/7. Only a couple of times I had to restart. All in all for the price it is a solid performer.
customer_reviews.author: RV

customer_reviews.title: Asus Zen Pad 3S 10, this one was a "lemon" !
customer_reviews.text: The Asus Zen pad arrived and, since I had one before and loved it, I assume this one would be just as good. Mistake...the screen flickered and made it frustrating to use. When I plugged it in to charge it, it didn't charge and I had only a black screen. Very disappointing, as my first one was dropped and resulted in a broken screen (Not purchased from Amazon) and i could find anyone who would repair it for less than $185.00. Seriously, I believe the Asus tablet from Amazon was just a "lemon".
customer_reviews.author: ladysmile

customer_reviews.title: Fast Tablet but problem one year in
customer_reviews.text: Was getting tired of older tablet speed and had reached the end of updates. Bought this one because processor was faster, screen is great. Only problem and why I took one star away, battery only lasted one year. Fortunately I purchased Square Trade and was able to get it fixed fairly quickly (sent and received back in one week). So other than the battery dying this tablet is everything I needed.
customer_reviews.author: BK

customer_reviews.title: If you cannot decide give this ASUS Tablet a try.
customer_reviews.text: Super video. Super sound. Great looking tablet. Very thin light and easy to hold. Received as a gift to fly my P4 and fits in the P4 cradle. I originally wanted a Samsung tab and bought one. I was not impressed and took it back to the store. I then received this and I am more than pleased. I will be checking out ASUS products more in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Lara Bramlett

customer_reviews.title: Very fast and a great bargain , awesome tablet !!!
customer_reviews.text: This is probably the best tablet I've ever owned and I've had a few. It is very fast and great for pretty much anything you have to do on a tablet. I love it and definitely can recommend Asus , they make great products that are very reasonably priced !!
customer_reviews.author: Ronnie B.

customer_reviews.title: Great Android tablet
customer_reviews.text: Very nice tablet. Fast, laid out well and the ASUS add one are generally useful and don't interfere with Android operating reliability. A significant improvement over my Nexus 7.
customer_reviews.author: Basementcleanup

customer_reviews.title: Nice Looking, Terrible Quality
customer_reviews.text: The tablet is nice looking but the quality is terrible. The battery drains really fast even when I don't even use it. It has only been a little over 30 days and the tablet touch screen stopped working. So now I had to send the tablet to Asus to get it repaired. If it had been less than 30 days I would've returned it. The tablet was even the newest model and after 30 days it stopped working. I would not recommend this tablet. I am highly disappointed. I will never ever buy this name brand, only Samsung.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Crashes Often
customer_reviews.text: In less than six months the tablet has started crashing at random. Crashes occur with increasing frequency. I have very few apps installed, mostly Google stuff and news apps (never play games). As yet, I’ve found no remedy. Suspect defective hardware. I think of Asus as a good brand, but this diminishes that perception greatly.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Evans Lee

customer_reviews.title: Best Android Tablet below $300
customer_reviews.text: Bought this Dec 2016 and still am very happy with it. Best Android tablet at this price point, and it just was updated to Android 7 Nougat.
customer_reviews.author: ThatGuy758600

customer_reviews.title: It Rocks
customer_reviews.text: This thing rocks, its quick (6- processors) no significant lag loading apps or mail or accessing the net, the screen res is awesome (not 4k - but still really nice), runs video nicely (Netflix/Prime), no jitter, plenty of memory especially with add-in SD card for add'l storage, has a little heft to it, battery life is days, more than 2x of my other tablets (one is ASUS memo pad 10 and its 2x of that). I waited to buy this, it's a bit spendy but worth it - wish I had done it before now!
customer_reviews.author: John Cip

customer_reviews.title: Performance on a par (or nearly so) to the Galaxy S3 at a significantly lower price
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a gift for my wife. I like it about as much as my Galaxy Tab S3 (which I really like). The screen is brilliant. Text is sharp. Processing is speedy. I should note that I cannot comment on how it performs while gaming. Neither my wife nor I actually play games on our tablets, so we cannot evaluate its performance for that purpose. At more than $100 less than the S3 (exactly $100 less if you get it today (Prime Day)), I consider this unit to be a bargain.
customer_reviews.author: ainsworth

customer_reviews.title: Serviceable tablet, good for the price
customer_reviews.text: pretty good tablet, although the first one had some issues. I was able to return it and the second one seems to be working just fine. the only problem is that the volume is not smooth, and even the minimum setting (above mute) is too loud for some situations. The hype with the stylus is just that, hype... The Asus stylus is basically useless with this particular tablet.
customer_reviews.author: Livio

customer_reviews.title: Just OK...and NOT for serious users
customer_reviews.text: They state, "Average Battery Life (in hours) 12 hours" -BUT- 4-hours of continuous use takes the battery down to 10%. Their claim must relate to how long the battery takes to run-down without use. This is my only complaint about the unit -BUT- it's a real problem for anyone who actually uses their tablet throughout the day, seven-days a week. I wouldn't buy another & am considering having to buy something that can get through a work-day without the charging cord.
customer_reviews.author: MTB

customer_reviews.title: this is the worst tablet ive ever owned
customer_reviews.text: ordered in may 2018, its december 2018 now. worst tablet ive owned by far, buggy inoperable operating system, all apps always crash, "fota service has stopped". its battery life deteriorates pretty slowly, the only positive. its so bad it freezes and turns off every 10 minutes or so. my use case consists of like 2 apps and google searches lol.
customer_reviews.author: D. Roach

customer_reviews.title: Do Not Buy
customer_reviews.text: From the very first day I pulled it out of the box where it has had this seeming glitch where the screen will just lock and shut off on its own. Sometimes it happens 10 times in 10 minutes, sometimes you can go for hours without it happening but I assure you it will happen . Really annoying, would not purchase again for this flaw alone. Also alot of apps and games in the android store are not available for the zenpad for some reason. Games that run on a 6 or 7 year old phone will not install on this tablet.
customer_reviews.author: david wachtel

customer_reviews.title: Quality hardware, but short battery life and sometimes screen doesn't recognize touch
customer_reviews.text: Mine has an issue where sometimes after a reboot the screen is 100% unresponsive. I've updated the firmware, and sometimes after booting it's fine, but sometimes the screen just doesn't react to touch. There's nothing other than rebooting repeatedly (anywhere between one to ten times using the power+volume down button to force it) I can find to make the screen work. I was going to RMA, but was about to leave town for three weeks and really wanted to have it for the long flights, so decided to deal with it. Battery life is also pretty mediocre. I have a previous generation ASUS 8" that seems to last for days on a charge, whereas this one drains pretty quickly.
customer_reviews.author: chris

customer_reviews.title: - Beautiful screen - Excellent battery life - Very little bloatware ...
customer_reviews.text: This is an incredible tablet for the prize. PROS: - Beautiful screen - Excellent battery life - Very little bloatware - Great onboard storage and Expandable Storage - Decent audio quality from the bottom-loaded speakers CONS: - Screen doesn't get very dim (I installed Nightshade app, which makes up for this) - Quick Charging only works with
customer_reviews.author: MartialCyclist

customer_reviews.title: "Not happy with ASUS ZenPad3S 10..!
customer_reviews.text: The "Worst Product" I every bought from ASUS...!!! I always support for Asus , like a German product top quality... It is gone...? So many problems, even this "ASUS ZenPad3S 10" is top from tablets...? Please, don't say again...!!! This product should not be on the market...! Wherry disappointed!!!! There should be production control better , before the product is sell !!! Right after warranty ,I asked for help, I got help 160$Us to fix it from ASUS tech. No thank You Friends...!!! George M.
customer_reviews.author: George

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Android tablet
customer_reviews.text: Excellent value for the money. Very fast (never saw any android device this fast), clear display. ZenUI is ok, would prefer original google UI, but not a big deal. Resolution is excellent. The only slightly irritating thing is that there is very little border from the edge of the screen to the touch sensitive area, which makes it hard to hold it without activating the touch in areas you don't intend to. But after a while you get accustomed to it.
customer_reviews.author: Jigal

customer_reviews.title: Will not charge, broken 3 times in 6 months
customer_reviews.text: I've had the device since April of 2017. In April of 2018, it would no longer charge so I was able to send it to ASUS for a warranty repair. I received the device and it worked for 2 weeks, and then broke again. Light use for 6 months, including not using any 3rd party cables to charge the device, and it just failed again. What a joke considering I paid $300 for this hunk of junk. I'm attempting to deal with their customer service again, wish me luck....
customer_reviews.author: number1stunna

customer_reviews.title: absolutely love this tablet
customer_reviews.text: absolutely love this tablet. nice crisp picture. fast handles the games i play just fine. the metal case can be a little flimsy around the buttons. had the edge and corner around them pop out when it bent after a 2 foot drop. luckily i was able to bend it back and its been fine since. be nice if they had a hard rugged case for this. the very small bezels on the 2 sides can be a problem and easy to hit the screen with palms when typing. but would still buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: mike

customer_reviews.title: I've had it over a month and it's been consistently awesome after a first replacement :)
customer_reviews.text: So far so good! I had a hiccup with the first one shutting down on its own, but Amazon's been great with their service and sent a new one; gave me a month to return the other; therefore, I took advantage to compare the two. I wanted to see if there was a individual folly or a consistent prob with the particular model overall, but whew! It was just uh-oh on that individual one as opposed a consistent boo-boo on all their Zenpad 3s models.
customer_reviews.author: Grace

customer_reviews.title: Like it, though it's buggy...
customer_reviews.text: It's great but lost one star because the touch screen will go crazy and start scrolling and selecting options on its own while my hand is just near it, very annoying! Also, it will sometimes not turn back on and be completely unresponsive at random. At this point you have to hold one button down while pressing another then after a few tries it'll come back to life, this is also very annoying. Aside from these problems, I really like this little tablet a lot and while I wish I could find a permanent solution, I am relatively happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Aoibheann

customer_reviews.title: but I still use them as a great reading utility and Reddit/chrome cast machine when going to ...
customer_reviews.text: Tablets are kind of a dying breed lately, but I still use them as a great reading utility and Reddit/chrome cast machine when going to bed. This ZenPad was a solid value for price. The screen and performance seem good. But the left/right bezels are definitely way too thin. It is incredibly easy to accidentally tap or scroll without even trying, which is kind of annoying. But overall I'm happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Van

customer_reviews.title: ASUS has horrible service.
customer_reviews.text: Amazon was great, but ASUS is horrible! Very dissapointed. After 2 weeks the pins on the USB C charge port bent inside the tablet just by inserting the provided charger. I called ASUS and their 1 year warranty does not apply for this. So I had to pay to get this fixed even thought it was a ASUS issue that they should of covered. And it was not cheep.
customer_reviews.author: Ilya

customer_reviews.title: Had problems with the mic when using skype after the ...
customer_reviews.text: Had problems with the mic when using skype after the device did a upgrade. Searching on the internet forums they suggested a work around by using skype lite. Tried it and worked for me. Only thing is that the skype shuts off by itself after a while (>20 min). Also screen casting with google chrome does not work not as expected too. But when using apps that can cast such as netflix or youtube the performance was ok.
customer_reviews.author: Dani M

customer_reviews.title: all good things. the only down side is that it ...
customer_reviews.text: Much faster than our old tablet and battery lasts lots longer...all good things. the only down side is that it took over 1-1/2 hours to turn on the first time as the tablet wanted to download and install the new android OS over the Wi-Fi. Not just a few updates, but an entire OS update. After that everything is good, though. Just not the Christmas morning experience I had planned for.
customer_reviews.author: tech guy

customer_reviews.title: ... Not much bloatware Very Fast This tablet is very nice tablet and it’s so powerful with a MediaTek 8176 ...
customer_reviews.text: Got 2k display 4GB DDR3 Ram Not much bloatware Very Fast This tablet is very nice tablet and it’s so powerful with a MediaTek 8176 it can perform a lot of tablets out there. This very good buy for midrange tablet. I love how it has Android 7. I hope it will get Android Oreo update. This tablet has the ability to use android apps and great processor with 6 cores wow & great for gaming on the go. I heard got 10 hours battery life.
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen M. Mills

customer_reviews.title: Excellent tablet
customer_reviews.text: The product was received on-time; good packaging by ASUS prevented any discernible damage. The tablet has been performing well / as specified since use began. Great display. Good sound: without headphones only so far. Upgraded to Android Nougat... Excellent tablet; ---Hoping that the tablet will last a long time. ---NOTE: I was a little surprised that the tablet did not come with it's own "complimentary" headphones.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great tablet
customer_reviews.text: All Asus products I have had are very well built. This one is no exceptions. There was only one cosmetic issue I could find where the bezel was not flush with the screen in one spot but not very much, would never have noticed if I wasn't looking for it. Screen is nice and large. If the battery runs all the way out it may have an issue starting up again, just don't let it go dead lol.
customer_reviews.author: Troy
